sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Twenty-five ships have carried over 600,000 tons of grain since a deal was brokered between Ukraine and Russia in recent weeks, easing fears of a global food crisis as supply routes were blocked amid fighting in the Eastern European country. I was in Odessa port and saw the first hand loading on a cargo of wheat onto a ship. I was so moved watching the wheat fill up the hold of the ship. It was the loading of hope for so many around the world. We are at the beginning of a much longer process, but you have already shown the potential of this critical agreement for the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Yesterday, Guterres visited Odessa, Ukraine's main port on the Black Sea, where he also called for financial aid for poorer countries facing food shortages. Ukraine's trading routes via Poland, Romania and Turkey faced disruption after Russia's invasion in February. But a landmark agreement means crucial grain shipments are now once again operating from the country's southern ports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Governor Mikhail Razvodsev told Telegram there was no significant damage or injuries, asking people to remain calm, that the city is under control and that authorities carried out operational services.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The headquarters was subject to an attack back on July 31st, where explosives hit the premises, injuring six people in the process.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Next Wednesday, however, marks Ukraine's Independence Day, where the country broke away from the Soviet Union in 1991.

sentences.sentence: As part of those celebrations this year, destroyed Russian tanks are being displayed in Kiev ahead of August 24th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Football fans and festival goers in the UK are among those affected with ongoing travel disruptions this weekend, as more than 45,000 rail workers took part in further strikes over pay and work conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's the third day of strike action in the past week, with the London Underground staff staging walkouts across its stations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: According to Network Rail, only one in five trains are in operation across all of England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: RMT union leader Mick Lynch says there will be further strike action in the foreseeable future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Transport Secretary Grant Shapps has tabled a pay rise offer to unions, but has since been refused.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But the strikes have not just been carried out by rail workers, and if anything, are gaining sympathy from other sectors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This Sunday, workers at the port of Felixstowe in the east of England, the largest freight port in the country, will begin an eight day strike threatening to bring the UK's economy to a further standstill.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Almost 15 years after Greece plunged into a financial crisis, the country is regaining control of its economy as the European Union ends its enhanced surveillance policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The bloc had carried out quarterly assessments of Greece's public finances in exchange for debt relief payments after the nation suffered a huge recession from 2009.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: These last three years constitute, in practice, a response to the lessons of the last 12 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They show the way that we never, ever go back to what we have lived through.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They forge our self-awareness and they urge us to move ahead united, armed with the truth and realistic solutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The end of the EU's enhanced surveillance will allow Greece greater freedom over its budget, as it, along with the rest of Europe, struggles with the rising cost of living and energy prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, the country will continue to pay back loans until 2070.

sentences.sentence: In the west of the country, like here in Wolfert, meteorologists reported record amounts of rainfall in the past 24 hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Firefighters and locals alike are working tirelessly to pick up fallen trees and clear flooded roads as best they can.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Over 1500 mudslides were recorded, making the cleanup job even more difficult. These mudslides led to numerous flooding of villages and roads. A large section of the A14 motorway along the Rhine valley had to be closed for many hours, causing motorists to take alternative routes in the severe conditions. The rainfall did stop around midnight and luckily no injuries have been reported.
